annotations: Dear Hiring Manager,
Thank you for considering me for a position at your organization.
I have been employed with my present employer, SUNY Downstate Health Sciences University for the past thirty (30) years.

I have experience working in various departments, ranging from a medical setting, interacting with patients and medical staff to my current position in the human resources administrative office. I will bring to your organization a hard working spirit, dedication, and the ability to work well with my colleagues. I am a quick learner, adaptable and reliable. I am computer skilled, detailed orientated and an effective communicator. I go over and beyond what is expected.
I look forward to hearing from you.
Sincerely,
Patricia C Burns
Patricia C. Burns
2080 First Avenue, Apt 3108
New York, New York 10029
Email: adpybk@r.postjobfree.com
PROFESSIONAL PROFILE
Professional with experience in various fields
Consistently provides clerical and administrative support
Organized, Detail-Oriented, Reliable, Ability to Adapt
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Office Assistant II-Administrative Assistant in the Department of Human Resources-SUNY Downstate Health Sciences University (formerly known as SUNY Downstate Medical Center), Brooklyn, NY, 2001- Present
Delivers the best customer service in communication; assist clients by addressing questions and concerns
Ability to retrieve employee information through HR computer systems; Payserv, SUNYHR and Image Silo/Application Xender.
Record Keeping; ensure personnel transactions received are logged, ensure documentation is given to the Records/Scanning Unit in a timely, organized manner
Ability to type letters, policies, procedures, memorandums under the direction of HR leadership, create spreadsheets using Microsoft Word and Excel
Copy and distribute time sensitive personnel transactions to the State Payroll Office
Complete documents and forms for departments use
Mail Letters, Oath of Office forms
Maintain confidentiality in handling sensitive information
Manage the HR Director’s office calendar through Microsoft Outlook
Arrange travel reservations for Director and colleagues for annual conferences
Provide receptionist coverage
Communicate status on various requests pertaining to changes in employment status
Works with campus staff in the Permanent Appointment process; receive recommendation packages, assist Department Administrators with completing required documentation

Assisted the Talent Acquisition (TA) Team with the onboarding process; by ensuring Pre-employment documents (USCIS I-9 form and supporting documentation) were given to candidates, and ensure forms are filled in properly, make copies of ID and/or visa documents, ensured the TA team validates the I-9 form, input information into the La Vie Development system for background screening checks, once screening reports were completed notify team for further processing

Processed all Voluntary/Unpaid Transactions for Faculty, Observers, and Medical Housestaff Residents; reviewed request packages for completion, ensured supporting documents including but not limited to HIPAA, Annual Mandatory Education and health clearance were included in the requests and notified department administrators if not included. Request Office of Inspector General (OIG) screening reports, Contact Medical Board on status of clinical privileges, if applicable.
Clerk II-Benefits Assistant -SUNY Downstate Medical Center, Brooklyn, NY, 1999-2001
Meet and assist new employees with benefits enrollment; retirement, health Insurance, etc.
Discuss benefits changes with employees
Maintain knowledge of current information of New York State Health Insurance, Retirement
Maintain employee personnel benefits files by filing documentation timely, organized
Distribute benefits updates with the campus community; mailing newsletters, letters, statements, flyers
Scheduled Orientation Sessions for new staff members
Order supplies, documentation, informational booklets
Nursing Station Clerk I – SUNY Downstate Medical Center, Brooklyn, NY, 1993-1999
Greet patients and visitors
Create medical charts upon patient admissions
File patient medical documentation timely and organized
Maintain Confidentiality
Process pharmaceutical and specimen orders for proper billing
Ensure proper names are on the patient room/doors for proper patient identification
Ensure patient census is up to date by monitoring admissions and discharges within the unit
Hospital Attendant I- SUNY Downstate Medical Center, Brooklyn, NY, 1991-1993
Escort Patients to and from Operating Room suite
Stock Operating Room with supplies
Prepare surgical instruments for sterilization
Knowledge of various types of surgical trays and instruments
EDUCATION
Certificate, ICD-10 and CPT Medical Coding Systems, SUNY Downstate Health Sciences University 2015
Certificate, SHRM Essentials of Human Resource Management, Pace University, 2006
Diploma, Theodore Roosevelt High School, 1990
SKILLS
Knowledge of Microsoft Office
Passed the NYS Department of Civil Service Examinations in Nursing Station Clerk, Clerk II and Office Assistant III
AFFILIATIONS
Member- Calvary Baptist Church, Manhattan, New York, 2003
Volunteer-Assisted circulating nurse in the Operating Room-SUNY Downstate Medical Center, Brooklyn, New York, 1990-1991
